title: Analista de Compras
description:
A Magnesium do Brasil é líder de negócios em pesquisa, beneficiamento e comercialização de magnesita. Com a visão de revelar o potencial do magnésio e tornar-se referência mundial no desenvolvimento, produção e comercialização de soluções de magnésio com qualidade, atuamos com portfólio de nutrição animal, massas refratárias e aplicações industriais. Pertencemos ao Groupe Roullier, que movido por uma energia coletiva, atua internacionalmente há mais de 60 anos em 8 áreas de atividade (Indústria Alimentar, Agrosupply, Fosfatos Alimentares, Magnésio, Nutrição Vegetal para o Público em Geral, Embalagem, Algologia e Energias Renováveis).

Todos os nossos funcionários incorporam nossos valores diariamente: Espírito de Equipe, Segurança, Desenvolvimento, Responsabilidade e Inovação. Comprometida com o desenvolvimento e a melhoria contínua, a Magnesium do Brasil está em constante evolução, colocando a experiência dos seus colaboradores no centro de todas as suas preocupações de gestão.

Nessa função, você terá a oportunidade de:

  • Participar ativamente da gestão das solicitações de compras do escopo de MRO, garantindo processos alinhados às demandas da fábrica.
  • Colaborar com as áreas internas, promovendo o entendimento das necessidades e sugerindo melhorias nos processos de compras.

Você será responsável por:

  • Gerenciar as solicitações de compras relacionadas ao escopo de MRO, garantindo que os processos sejam realizados de forma eficiente e alinhada às necessidades operacionais da fábrica.
  • Atender com qualidade e assertividade os pedidos dos clientes internos, assegurando a entrega de soluções que atendam aos prazos, padrões de qualidade e custos esperados.
  • Negociar com fornecedores, buscando as melhores condições comerciais e parcerias estratégicas.
  • Manter um relacionamento próximo com as áreas internas para entender as demandas e propor melhorias contínuas nos processos de compras.
  • Acompanhar o desempenho dos fornecedores, avaliando critérios como pontualidade, qualidade e custo-benefício.

Em troca, oferecemos-lhe:

Um ambiente cheio de desafios, com oportunidades de crescimento e desenvolvimento. Nossa fábrica possui um ambiente de trabalho respeitoso e alegre, resultado da nossa cultura.

Por que juntar-se a nós?

Juntar-se a nós é atrever-se a fazer a diferença, a tomar iniciativas, a saber transformar dificuldades em oportunidades e a colocar o seu talento ao serviço de um coletivo, de uma ambição partilhada: Crescer Juntos é caminhar juntos na mesma direção.

Requisitos:

  • Formação superior completa em Administração, Logística, Gestão de Suprimentos ou áreas correlatas
  • Nível intermediário no Pacote Office (Excel, Word e PowerPoint)
  • Experiência com MRO será um diferencial
#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Quarry Relationship Manager
description:
The Quarry Relationship Manager will be responsible for establishing and maintaining strategic partnerships with quarries to secure high-quality feedstock critical to Terradot’s operations. This role is key to negotiating contracts, managing long-term relationships, and aligning quarry capabilities with our ambitious goals for Enhanced Rock Weathering (ERW) deployments. By leveraging their expertise in the mining sector, particularly in aggregates and remineralizers, the Quarry Relationship Manager will ensure sustainable supply chains and scalable operations.

Location: São Paulo, Brazil, or close to project hubs with flexible remote work arrangements when not traveling.

Languages: Fluent Portuguese required; English proficiency preferred.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain strong partnerships with quarries to ensure a sustainable supply of feedstock for ERW operations.
  • Negotiate contracts with quarries, clearly defining quality standards, timelines, and responsibilities to meet operational goals.
  • Evaluate and document quarry capabilities, including stock availability, production capacity, and beneficiation methods, while maintaining an organized partner database.
  • Collaborate with the scientific team to identify opportunities to optimize quarry operations, improving feedstock quality.
  • Develop and implement strategies to mitigate feedstock shortages, ensuring long-term scalability and reliability of supply chains.
  • Act as a liaison between quarries and Terradot’s internal teams, facilitating communication and alignment on project goals.
  • Monitor and report on quarry performance, ensuring compliance with contract terms and Terradot’s operational standards.

Background and Requirements:

  • Minimum of 5 years in the mining sector, ideally in aggregates or remineralizers, or with mining machinery suppliers.
  • Proven knowledge of production processes, beneficiation methods, machinery costs, and material characteristics in quarry operations.
  • Advanced negotiation and contract management skills; proficiency in analyzing production costs and operational feasibility.
  • Degree in Mining Engineering, Geology, or a related field preferred but not required with equivalent experience.
  • Database management skills and familiarity with tools to track and evaluate quarry key indicators.

Personal Attributes:

  • A strategic thinker who can align quarry capabilities with Terradot’s long-term goals.
  • Highly adaptable and able to work with diverse stakeholders, from technical teams to commercial leaders.
  • A strong communicator with a hands-on approach to problem-solving and relationship management.
  • Proactive and solution-oriented, with a focus on achieving measurable outcomes.
  • Passionate about contributing to sustainability and innovative carbon removal solutions.

About Us

Our mission is to stabilize Earth’s climate by transforming nature’s most powerful permanent carbon removal process into a global climate solution. By advancing science, building technology, and assembling a global coalition, we are catalyzing a global initiative to scale Enhanced Rock Weathering within the next decade, starting in Brazil.

Founded out of the Stanford University ecosystem, Terradot is led by the world’s leading experts to advance the science and technology of ERW. Our unique structure bridges industry, academia, and government and allows our team to contribute with speed & scale. We are backed by John Doerr, Sheryl Sandberg & Tom Bernthal, George Roberts, Microsoft’s Climate Innovation Fund, Google, Cisco and Venture Funds, Floodgate, Kleiner Perkins, Acre Venture Partners, Gigascale Capital, Valor Capital, Ponderosa Ventures and others.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage individuals who believe they have the skills necessary to thrive to apply for this role.

title: Software Architect Remote, Brazil - Engineering
description:
What You'll Do

We are seeking an experienced and visionary Architect of Software Engineering to lead the design and development of complex software systems. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of architectural principles, software design patterns, and modern development practices. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to create scalable, secure, and high-performance solutions that meet both current and future business needs. Your expertise will guide the engineering team in building robust software that aligns with the company's strategic goals.

What Your Responsibilities Will Be

  • Architectural Leadership: Define and drive the overall software architecture strategy, ensuring alignment with business objectives and technology vision.
  • System Design: Lead the design of complex software systems, ensuring scalability, security, and maintainability. Develop high-level product specifications and design documents.
  • Technical Guidance: Provide expert guidance to software engineering teams on architectural best practices, design patterns, and coding standards. Mentor and support developers in implementing best practices.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, UX designers, DevOps, and other stakeholders to ensure that the software architecture supports business goals and user needs.
  • Technology Evaluation: Stay abreast of emerging technologies and trends. Evaluate and recommend tools, frameworks, and platforms that will enhance the development process and product quality.
  • Code Reviews: Conduct code and design reviews to ensure adherence to architectural standards and best practices.
  • Performance Optimization: Identify performance bottlenecks in the software architecture and lead efforts to optimize system performance, scalability, and reliability.
  • Documentation: Create and maintain architectural documentation, including system diagrams, technical specifications, and design patterns.
  • Risk Management: Identify potential technical risks in projects and propose solutions to mitigate them.
  • Innovation: Foster a culture of innovation within the engineering team, encouraging the exploration of new ideas and approaches.
  • Project Involvement: Participate in project planning, estimation, and review processes, ensuring that architectural considerations are integrated into the overall project plan.
  • Compliance and Security: Ensure that the software architecture complies with relevant security standards, regulations, and best practices.

What You’ll Need To Be Successful

  • You have a Bachelor / Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
  • You have 15+ years of full-stack experience in software development roles, shipping applications to large-scale production environments.
  • You'll be an expert in C# or Java programming language.
  • You have knowledge of architectural styles and design patterns allowing you to solve complex problems with simple, intuitive design.
  • You have experience in building, and deploying (CI/CD) scalable distributed systems and frameworks for small businesses and enterprises.
  • You have experience working on AWS Cloud and DevOps (Terraform, Docker, ECS) would be beneficial.
  • You've been part of an Agile team with hands-on experience with TDD and BDD.
  • You have experience converting monoliths to microservices or serverless architecture.
  • TOGAF, AWS Solutions Architect, or similar certifications.
  • Knowledge of Enterprise Integration Patterns.
  • Fluent English is a requirement for this role, therefore only resumes in English will be considered.

How We’ll Take Care Of You

Total Rewards

In addition to a great compensation package, paid time off, and paid parental leave, many Avalara employees are eligible for bonuses.

Health & Wellness
Benefits vary by location but generally include private medical, life, and disability insurance.

Inclusive culture and diversity
Avalara strongly supports diversity, equity, and inclusion, and is committed to integrating them into our business practices and our organizational culture. We also have a total of 8 employee-run resource groups, each with senior leadership and exec sponsorship.

Learn more about our benefits by region here:Avalara North America

What You Need To Know About Avalara

We’re Avalara. We’re defining the relationship between tax and tech. We’ve already built an industry-leading cloud compliance platform, processing nearly 40 billion customer API calls and over 5 million tax returns a year. Last year, we became a billion-dollar business, and our tribe expanded by a cool thousand people - there’s nearly 5,000 of us now. Our growth is real, and we’re not slowing down - not until we’ve achieved our mission - to be part of every transaction in the world.

We’re bright, innovative and disruptive, like the orange we love to wear. It captures our quirky spirit and optimistic mindset. It shows off the culture we’ve designed, that empowers our people to win. Ownership and achievement go hand in hand here. We instill passion in our people through the trust we place in them. We’ve been different from day one. Join us, and your career will be too.

We’re An Equal Opportunity Employer

Supporting diversity and inclusion is a cornerstone of our company — we don’t want people to fit into our culture, but to enrich it. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, gender, national orientation, disability, sexual orientation, US Veteran status, or any other factor protected by law. If you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: ANALISTA DE TELECOM SÊNIOR
description:
Para se candidatar a esta vaga clique aqui e crie seu currículo.

Descrição da Vaga

Estamos em busca de um Analista de Telecom Sênior altamente qualificado, com forte expertise em LTE/4G, para integrar nossa equipe de tecnologia. O profissional será responsável por garantir a operação e otimização de redes de telecomunicações, com foco especial em tecnologias LTE/4G. Também trabalhará com sistemas de radiocomunicação Motorola, Hytera, DAMM entre outros fabricantes.

Responsabilidades

  1. Gerenciar e otimizar a rede LTE/4G, garantindo alta disponibilidade e desempenho.
  2. Realizar análises de performance e troubleshooting em redes LTE/4G.
  3. Implementar e acompanhar processos de melhoria contínua na rede.
  4. Colaborar com a equipe de engenharia para desenvolver e implementar soluções inovadoras.
  5. Realizar testes de novos equipamentos e tecnologias.
  6. Produzir relatórios técnicos detalhados sobre o desempenho da rede.
  7. Participar de projetos de expansão e atualização da rede.
  8. Fornecer suporte técnico de alto nível para a equipe de operação e manutenção.
  9. Trabalhar com sistemas de radiocomunicação da Motorola, Hytera, Tait e DAMM.

Requisitos Indispensáveis

  1. Formação superior em Engenharia de Telecomunicações, Engenharia Elétrica, Ciência da Computação ou áreas correlatas.
  2. Experiência mínima de 4 anos em posições similares.
  3. Sólidos conhecimentos em tecnologias LTE/4G.
  4. Experiência comprovada em configuração e gerenciamento de redes de telecomunicações.
  5. Habilidade em troubleshooting e resolução de problemas complexos.
  6. Conhecimento em protocolos de rede, segurança e qualidade de serviço (QoS).
  7. Familiaridade com ferramentas de monitoramento e análise de desempenho de redes.
  8. Inglês avançado para leitura e redação de documentação técnica.

Requisitos Desejáveis

  1. Certificações específicas em telecomunicações (ex.: LTE, 4G, 5G, etc.).
  2. Experiência com outras tecnologias de rede (5G, VoLTE, etc.).
  3. Conhecimentos em programação e automação de redes.
  4. Pós-graduação na área de telecomunicações ou afins.

title: Hotelmanager Regio Limburg / Brabant (3 locaties)
description:
Ben jij een ervaren leidinggevende in de hospitality industrie? Heb je de capaciteit om een team te inspireren en de operationele processen soepel te laten verlopen? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Taken en Verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Aannemen, trainen en begeleiden van medewerkers.
  • Aansturen en motiveren van het personeel.
  • Medewerkers opleiden, actief kennis overdragen en coachen.
  • Beheer van het operationele budget (inslag, LP kosten).
  • Streven naar het verhogen van de omzet.
  • Verbeteren van de gasttevredenheid.
  • Handhaven van hoge kwaliteitsstandaarden/normen.
  • Zorgen voor hoge medewerkerstevredenheid en laag verloop.
  • Samenwerken met andere afdelingen en het hoofdkantoor om doelstellingen te behalen.

Dit heb jij in huis:

  • Ervaring als hotelmanager in de hospitality industrie of in een centraal aangestuurde filiaalorganisatie.
  • Leidinggevende vaardigheden met het vermogen om een team te bouwen en te inspireren.
  • Organisatorische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden.
  • Goede planning en prioritering van taken.
  • Sterke communicatievaardigheden, zowel emotioneel als intellectueel.
  • Flexibel, stressbestendig en in staat om te werken in een dynamische 24/7 omgeving.
  • No-nonsense mentaliteit, harde werker met oog voor kostenbeheersing.
  • MBO 4 / HBO denk- en werkniveau.
  • Geen 0900 tot 1700 mentaliteit, bereidheid om ook in de weekenden te werken.

Wat bieden wij jou?

  • Uitdagende functie met veel verantwoordelijkheid.
  • Hecht team met leuke collega’s.
  • Vrijheid om deels zelf je werk in te plannen.
  • Uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden afgestemd op opleiding en ervaring.
  • Auto van de zaak.
  • Carrière- en opleidingsmogelijkheden.
  • Platte en relatief jonge organisatie met mooie groeimogelijkheden.

Doorgroeimogelijkheden

Bij Bastion Hotels zijn er tal van interne doorgroeimogelijkheden. Je kan bijvoorbeeld doorgroeien naar een leuke functie op het hoofdkantoor!

Klinkt dit als jouw droombaan en ben jij klaar om impact te maken bij de leukste hotelketen van Nederland? Solliciteer dan via bovenstaande knop!

title: Sales Manager - Events
description:
Our client organises major iGaming events globally, including in Brazil, and is seeking a Sales Manager with a hunter mindset to drive revenue growth across their event portfolio. In this role, you will primarily focus on the Brazilian event, selling sponsorships and exhibition space, while also managing accounts across Latin America and selling throughout the global portfolio.

Essential Job Functions / Main Duties & Responsibilities:

  1. Sell event sponsorship and exhibition space across the company’s growing event portfolio that includes conferences, trade shows, awards and other events spanning multiple continents.
  2. Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients as well as new customers, by listening to them, understanding their needs and selling the company’s events to meet those needs.
  3. Represent the company in Brazil and Latin America by building strong relationships across suppliers, operators, affiliates, associations, other associated businesses and industry stakeholders.
  4. Contribute to the company’s growth strategy across Brazil and Latin America by providing market intelligence and new ideas to meet the needs of our clients and partners, as well as potential business opportunities for the company.
  5. Work with Chief Growth Officer to establish revenue targets across the region and translate these into actionable sales strategies.
  6. Work closely with colleagues on the events, conference production, media, relationship and marketing teams to ensure the company delivers the promised services to the clients’ expectations, and preferably above expectations.
  7. Make key contributions to ensuring potential is realized for flagship event(s); ability to join the dots across strategy, speakers, relationships and marketing.
  8. Contribute to the sales team growth and effort by achieving consistent and growing sales results, and by providing feedback and input to improve our events and services to better meet customer needs.
  9. Manage the sales cycle; including sales planning, lead generation, relationship building and management, as well as sales reporting.
  10. Provide feedback on sales packages, sales materials and sales presentations to help the team ensure that they are continually improved and always up to date.
  11. Profile both new and existing customers by consistently using the CRM system, collecting and updating contact information and logging all activity, to keep it up to date and complete.
  12. In time, as justified by the growing client portfolio, hire and develop a sales team to further exploit the commercial opportunity in the region.
  13. Attend and represent the company at events and exhibitions across Latin America, North America and Europe.

Skills & Qualifications:

  1. A strong, demonstrable background of B2B sales and/or account management and relationship building.
  2. Experience with sales planning / account management, client outreach and reporting.
  3. Excellent interpersonal skills, able to open doors and build rapport and deep relationships with industry executives across levels.
  4. Fluent in Portuguese.
  5. Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
  6. Able to deal with rapidly changing priorities and business circumstances.
  7. Strongly results-driven.

title: Motorista Carreteiro
description:
A Magnesium do Brasil é líder de negócios em pesquisa, beneficiamento e comercialização de magnesita. Com a visão de revelar o potencial do magnésio e tornar-se referência mundial no desenvolvimento, produção e comercialização de soluções de magnésio com qualidade, atuamos com portfólio de nutrição animal, massas refratárias e aplicações industriais. Pertencemos ao Groupe Roullier, que movido por uma energia coletiva, atua internacionalmente há mais de 60 anos em 8 áreas de atividade (Indústria Alimentar, Agrosupply, Fosfatos Alimentares, Magnésio, Nutrição Vegetal para o Público em Geral, Embalagem, Algologia e Energias Renováveis).

Todos os nossos funcionários incorporam nossos valores diariamente: Espírito de Equipe, Segurança, Desenvolvimento, Responsabilidade e Inovação. Comprometida com o desenvolvimento e a melhoria contínua, a Magnesium do Brasil está em constante evolução, colocando a experiência dos seus colaboradores no centro de todas as suas preocupações de gestão.

Você será responsável por:

  1. Dirigir caminhões LS;
  2. Fazer a lista de verificação do veículo e da documentação antes da viagem;
  3. Informar ao gestor da área sobre a necessidade de manutenção preventiva e corretiva do veículo antecipadamente;
  4. Seguir os procedimentos, normas de segurança e leis de trânsito;
  5. Praticar a direção defensiva.

Para ter sucesso nessa função, você deverá:

  1. Ter em mente que Segurança e Qualidade são prioridades em qualquer execução de atividade;
  2. Ser capaz de se comunicar eficazmente com a equipe, fornecedores e outros departamentos;
  3. Espírito de equipe, apresentando humildade e colaboração no dia a dia;
  4. Ter uma abordagem proativa e responsável em relação às suas responsabilidades, demonstrando comprometimento com o sucesso da equipe e da organização;
  5. Ser minucioso e preciso em suas tarefas, garantindo que nenhum detalhe importante seja negligenciado.

Requisitos:

  1. Boa comunicação, proatividade, senso de responsabilidade, organização;
  2. Experiência comprovada na função será um diferencial;
  3. Disponibilidade para viagens interestaduais;
  4. Ser residente em Fortaleza/CE ou proximidades.

Um ambiente cheio de desafios, com oportunidades de crescimento e desenvolvimento. Nossa fábrica possui um ambiente de trabalho respeitoso e alegre, resultado da nossa cultura.

Juntar-se a nós é atrever-se a fazer a diferença, a tomar iniciativas, a saber transformar dificuldades em oportunidades e a colocar o seu talento ao serviço de um coletivo, de uma ambição partilhada: Crescer Juntos é caminhar juntos na mesma direção.

title: EXECUTIVO DE CONTAS II
description:
Olá, pessoa candidata!

Na Air Liquide valorizamos a inclusão e diversidade, por isso, temos a felicidade de informar que você está participando de um processo de seleção anônima, ou seja, nenhuma informação pessoal estará disponível, sua avaliação se dará pelas competências técnicas e, posteriormente, em sua entrevista comportamental.

Por gentileza, preencha todos os campos de sua aplicação com a maior riqueza de detalhes possível, lembrando que isso é essencial para a sua avaliação no processo de seleção anônima.

Sobre Air Liquide

Por meio da paixão e da diversidade do seu pessoal, a Air Liquide alavanca a transição de energia e meio ambiente, mudanças na área de saúde e digitalização, e oferece maior valor a todos os seus acionistas.

Junte-se a nós em uma experiência estimulante: você encontrará um mundo de oportunidades de aprendizagem e desenvolvimento onde a criatividade está no centro do que fazemos, em um ambiente aberto, colaborativo e respeitoso.

Como você vai CONTRIBUIR e CRESCER?

Responsável por uma região geográfica definida, pensada e desenvolvida estrategicamente onde realiza a negociação comercial, proposta de vendas, manutenção, desenvolvimento e ampliação da Carteira de Clientes e Novas Contas no segmento medicinal e ampliar os investimentos dos clientes nos produtos e serviços ofertados pela empresa, tais como maximizar os recursos aplicados em cilindros, tanques, instalações etc, objetivando fechar todos os negócios e resultados, de acordo com as metas contratadas.

Você possui esses requisitos?

  1. Superior completo
  2. CNH ativa

Suas diferenças impulsionam nosso desempenho

Na Air Liquide, temos o compromisso de construir um local de trabalho diversificado e inclusivo, isso quer dizer que, independente da sua identidade de gênero, orientação sexual, cor, idade, religião, nacionalidade ou deficiência, nós valorizamos um ambiente de trabalho composto por histórias verdadeiras, construídas por pessoas verdadeiras.

Acreditamos fortemente que uma organização diversificada abre oportunidades para as pessoas expressarem seu talento, tanto individual quanto coletivamente, e ajuda a fomentar nossa capacidade de inovar ao viver nossos fundamentos, agindo para nosso sucesso e criando um ambiente envolvente em um mundo em mudança.

Aqui você pode ser você!!

About Us

A world leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health.

Through the passion and diversity of its people, Air Liquide leverages energy and environment transition, changes in healthcare and digitization, and delivers greater value to all its stakeholders.

Join us for a stimulating experience: you’ll find a world of learning and development opportunities where inventiveness is at the heart of what we do, in an open, collaborative and respectful environment.

Discover what your professional journey at Air Liquide could be here!

company: Michael Page International do Brasil Recrutamento Especializado Ltda

title: Mechanical Supervisor
description:
Mechanical Supervisor

Location: Offshore facilities
Rotation: 5 weeks on/5 weeks off
Contract duration: to be defined
Client: Dietsmann Group

Category: Mechanical / Hydraulic
Country: Brazil

The Mechanical Supervisor is responsible for overseeing the maintenance and performance of critical mechanical equipment, with a primary focus on turbomachinery such as gas turbines and compressors. This role involves ensuring efficient operations, consistent implementation of maintenance procedures, and effective collaboration with internal teams, contractors, and equipment manufacturers. The Mechanical Supervisor will report directly to the Maintenance Manager and play a crucial role in maintaining platform reliability and safety standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Turbomachinery Oversight:
  • Contribute to reporting to the Maintenance Manager on turbomachinery performance, critical activities, and work program progress related to upgrades and overhauls.
  • Provide technical support for the maintenance and performance evaluation of main turbomachinery equipment on platforms, including gas turbines, gas compressors, and associated auxiliaries.
  • Operational & Procedural Management:
  • Ensure the consistent implementation of procedures for the operation, training, and maintenance of platform turbomachinery.
  • Collaborate with operations teams to optimize maintenance strategies for turbomachinery and other critical mechanical assets.
  • Serve as the main interface with equipment manufacturers for troubleshooting, upgrades, and support.
  • Conduct quality assurance on equipment overhauls by visiting supplier workshops, witnessing performance tests, and ensuring compliance with standards.
  • Procurement Support:
  • Provide technical support to procurement teams by reviewing quotes, specifications, and supplier proposals.
  • Draft detailed technical descriptions for the procurement of services, materials, and equipment related to maintenance activities.
  • Develop and maintain constructive relationships with contractors and suppliers.
  • Identify opportunities to enhance contractor/supplier performance, reduce costs, and improve service quality.
  • Project & Modification Management:
  • Prepare scopes of work for minor modifications and ensure proper engineering, documentation, and reporting.
  • Oversee maintenance and modification projects to ensure compliance with standards, regulations, budgets, and schedules.
  • Analyze and define the most effective maintenance strategies for turbomachinery and other mechanical equipment to maximize uptime and performance.
  • Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE):
  • Ensure all maintenance activities adhere to HSE standards and company regulations.
  • Actively participate in safety audits and promote a culture of safety within the team.

Candidate Profile

Education: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or equivalent technical certification.

Experience: Minimum of 7 years of experience in mechanical maintenance within the oil & gas industry, with a strong emphasis on turbomachinery (gas turbines and compressors).

Proficiency in performance evaluation and maintenance of turbomachinery.

Strong understanding of HSE standards and industry regulations.

Ability to prepare technical documentation and scopes of work.

Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and decision-making skills.

Strong interpersonal and communication skills for effective collaboration with diverse teams and stakeholders.

Working Languages: English and Portuguese.

Other Requirements: Willingness to travel for supplier inspections, workshops, and fieldwork as required. Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities effectively.
